column4: I am having a very serious issue, suddenly -- every video I watch now, whether it is .mov or .avi is really dark, and of negative colours. It started only a few minutes ago, after a restart, and ever since -- new restarts don't fix this problem.
what media player and what video output? and what vga are you on?
ANY media player I am using displays it like that (mplayer, totem, vlc). what do you mean by "what video output" or "what vga"?
media players have a video output. xv is by default. its location in the options depends on the player. vga is the graphics card you have
but how can I check that, in order to answer you? And -- why would it change -- here is, I only restarted my computer
well you can look at the media players options for the video output. and i also need the graphics card too. to find it             lspci | grep VGA
thanks for your help. First answer (out of two): 00:02.0 VGA compatible controller: Intel Corporation Mobile 945GM/GMS, 943/940GML Express Integrated Graphics Controller (rev 03)
I couldn't find an answer to the second question, but here's mplayer's output, maybe it helps: http://paste.freeallweb.org/90
are you good enough with the terminal so as to start a movie with mplayer from it?
yes, I am "good enough" with the terminal. Actually, it's Gnome that I am not "good enough" with (hence I try to use as many command-line programs as possible, instead of gui ones)
try this then                  mplayer -vo x11 file.avi
see how it goes
and continue with other video output methods ( -vo) like xv, gl and gl2
very good!
so, something messed with my default vo ?
it does play with xv normally?
xv is bad
well can you full screen it with x11? F is the shortcut key for it
gl and gl2 are good
does x11 fullscreen properly? i get a strange border when i do it in mine
it keeps a black frame around it - it does not enlarge the picture. also, using -gui it did not work
best overal use is xv, then x11, then gl and gl2
go with gl then
wait, but what happened with xv ?
i think it is some driver parameter for it. only nvidias work perfectly with xv :(
but now when I double click a movie in Gnome, or try -gui in mplayer command line, so I have to use x11 and it is (suddenly!) not wroking
there is somewhere in preferences. look it up
in the preferneces of what? of mplayer + totem + vlc + ... ?
mplayer at first. find that and make sure it works and you can do the rest later

but do you realise that something is not proper here? One of two things happened here: a. the default preferneces of *all* of my video software had changed, or b. something general has happened. I want to solve the general thing, assuming that this is probably the thing that had happened
the default preferences of all players are xv video output! one bad thing in sv affects all.
ok, so that's what I prefer to solve. xv worked just fine, then, until 1 hour ago. Why should it kill itself just like that, after a restart?
were the intel drivers updated? or xorg itself?
how can I know that? I don't think so, but could it be that it happened without letting me know?
I think I have reinstalled totem before the restart, but I am not sure it was before *that* restart
sudo cat /var/log/dpkg.log | tail
nice! here: 2008-12-15 12:15:26 status unpacked totem-gstreamer 2.20.0-0ubuntu3
any other lines?
yes, all related. I'll paste it
pastebin them if possible
http://paste.freeallweb.org/91
or maybe you want a longer tail?
yes please
http://paste.freeallweb.org/92 <-- this is the longest relevant tail, I believe
give me a sec.
I am not in a hurry, take your time. thanks for your help!
sudo cat /var/log/apt/term.log | tail                this tells it in a more apt way, can you please do that too? and add a bigger tail of like 50
sure
http://paste.freeallweb.org/93
well it seems clean.... unless that package removal made a mess gstreamer0.10-plugins-bad-multiverse
so, what do you recommend? should I uninstall most of these and reinstall them?
why uninstall? and what to uninstall? does gstreamer-properties work for you?
I thought that if I'll try to revert the changes that I've maid, the "mess" will be reorganised... I'll try gstreamer-properties
in video tab, what do you get under defautl output?
plugin: autodetect
can you change it to xv or the one below it?
yes. should I do it? and then what?
then try totem and vlc again

funny, there's this testing button; when I chose "no xv", the test gives me colours from left (bright) to right (dark), and something moves as well; when I chose the second option (X11/.../xv) the test seems to give me negative colours
lol
i get the same colort
so, we didn't solve the problem, but we know exactly what caused it
true :(
hey, watch this:
oops, here it is: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/xserver-xorg-video-intel/+bug/32963
thats hilarious!
indeed. I am still reading

haha!!! do you know what solved the problem? watching the movie, and *while* the movie is working (but not before), running a command that will modify xv-attributes, and then it changed everything back to normal. It is said there that if I'll run totem again, it will be bad again. I won't run totem, then!!
i use mplayer and i dont trust any gstreamer frontend like totem and kaffeine
yes, I also use only mplayer; but I thought that I'll need this totem (hence I installed it) to watch that m4v...
my mplayer does play m4v!
really? I'll try that again, then
not any mplayer! THE mplayer... from the medibuntu repo
what do you mean? how do I know which mplayer do I have at the moment? I don't think I have medibuntu in my sources list
remove the one you have now. put the medibuntu repo in your sources. clean apt cach and it will install mplayer from there
you know what, I am not sure I need it. I am sending this video to my windows-based a-technological family, so I think that re-encoding it as .avi will be the best thing to do anyway...
or you can give your family a nice mplayer frontend for windows, like gomplayer, and save yourself the time and effort

haha! no, it's my extended family. I don't know which laptop they'll bring to the party, and I am not going to check that out... it'll take more time. jim_p: things are even more complicated than that: I live in London, they live in Israel. anyway, trust me -- I believe that re-encoding it will be the best thing to do ;-)
ok

ok mplayer (without medibuntu) *does* play the m4v, but with weird gray embossing in the first few seconds... :(  -- though, I have discovered that vlc plays it right. I can't get ffmpeg to transfer it to avi -- but if I can play it, sure something decodes it, right?
what embossing?
it just looks gray in the beginning
does it appear for long?
just a few seconds. though, if I run-forward, than it stays with me, and actually cause some bugs either
let me look at my video of the same kind
do you think medibuntu has a different version of ffmpeg as well?
i dont think, it DOES
I see. maybe I'll give it a try then. how did you say? purge, clean cache, update source list, install ?
yes
thanks; and what is the url for that repo?
thanks
I am following their tutorial, but again and again I am stuck in this phase: " sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install medibuntu-keyring && sudo apt-get update"
